title: (x) Fein Pro corporate faces - Gill Sans Alt. 1, Berthold Akzidenz-Grotesk Cd {Dav, Einrini}
content:
dear typophiles,

what is the closest you can get to this corporate font?

thanks in advance  
thomas

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [fein.pdf](http://web.archive.org/web/20131019185250/http:/typophile.com/files/fein.pdf) | 35.25 KB |
author: curtze

comments.content: have a look at the numbers...

And 'Helvetica _( Condensed )_' ( ? )

_( Oh, And, Yea, Different numbers, well only the '1', it seems, and they could have easily customized that one )_

Dav

The last sample could be Akzidenz Extra Bold Condensed

Eirini

thanks guys, that helps already.  
cheers

thomas

[http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/agfa/gill-sans-2/gill-alt-one-mt/](http://web.archive.org/web/20131019185250/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/agfa/gill-sans-2/gill-alt-one-mt/ "http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/agfa/gill-sans-2/gill-alt-one-mt/")

No need to customise, that's the Alt One version of Gill Sans.  
Tim
Question for the law-hounds out there: Is this cricket?

You never know with corporate type. Either they purchased the proper corporate-wide license and renamed the fonts for convenience, or these are ripped-off fonts sold to them by a lazy bureau or designer.
interesting questions – i'll ask next time i'm with the client.

so i asked the client: they licensed the fonts and renamed them. they weren't sure about which ones they originally used, most likely akzidenz grotesk berthold and gill obviously.

thanks for your help, everyone.  
cheers  
t
